author: cmpilato
msg: Finish issue #1897.  Fix a "wc not locked" bug in relegating externals
that contains subdirectories.
* subversion/include/svn_wc.h
(svn_wc_adm_open2): Change a hyphen used as an emdash to a double
hyphen ('--').  Since the 'depth' argument can be negative, that
single hyphen almost read like '-1'.
* subversion/libsvn_client/externals.c
(relegate_external): Use -1 for the depth when opening externals
we're just going to wipe from disk.  Patch portion by Ross Mark
<rossm@controllingedge.com.au>.
* subversion/tests/clients/cmdline/externals_tests.py
(test_list): Un-XFail the following tests: update_receive_new_external,
update_lose_external, update_change_pristine_external,
update_change_modified_external.

author: cmpilato
msg: Change the test suite to test some externals that have depth to them.
Prior to this change, all our externals used in externals testing were
no more than a single directory and some files -- no subdirectories.
Using externals with an actual depth reveals a bug fixed by the patch
in issue #1897 (the commit of which is forthcoming).
* subversion/tests/clients/cmdline/externals_tests.py
(externals_test_setup): Instead of hooking externals onto A/B, hook
them to A/C.  Instead of using .../A/B/E as an external, use .../A/B.
Why?  Because we have no testing for externals that are deeper
than a single directory!
(checkout_with_externals, update_receive_change_under_external
export_with_externals): Look in the right places for the new
externals.
(test_list): XFail the following tests: update_receive_new_external,
update_lose_external, update_change_pristine_external,
update_change_modified_external

author: martinto
msg: * contrib/hook-scripts/check-case-insensitive.pl:
Move the stuff which needs to be configured nearer
the top of the script.
Attempt to get UTF-8 character checks to work with
some success.

author: sussman
msg: Followup to issue 1817.  'svnadmin hotcopy' should run catastrophic
recovery, rather than normal recovery.
* libsvn_fs_base/fs.c
(bdb_catastrophic_recover): new function, same as base_bdb_recovery,
but opens environment with DB_RECOVER_FATAL instead of DB_RECOVER.
(base_hotcopy): call the new function, and possibly wrap the error
describing the race-condition with auto-logfile removal.

author: cmpilato
msg: * contrib/hook-scripts/commit-block-joke.py
Add joke script.  Fun for administrators.
(Unfortunately, while a trial run, setup to remove itself after a
successful trigger, did prevent Ben Reser from getting r10000 without
first retrying a failed commit, it seems he never saw the nice error
output the script generates).
